          <h2>
           Search Google Scholar for Articles
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_20" id="content10101170">
          <div id="boxatt10101170" class="boxatt">
           <label for="searchText10101170">
            <img alt="Google Scholar Logo" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/google_scholar.jpg" />
           </label>
           <br />
           <input type="text" value="" id="searchText10101170" class="google_search_box" title="Google scholar search" />
           <br />
           <input type="button" onclick="var queryString = document.getElementById('searchText10101170').value;queryString = queryString.replace(/\\+/g, '+');var url = 'http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=' + queryString;window.open(url,'GScholar');" value="Search" />
          </div>

     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox18744883">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18744883">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18744883">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Barbara Cruikshank (2 September 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18744883">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by Barbara Cruikshank
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            "Feminism and Punishment."
            <i>
             Signs: Journal of Women in Culture &amp; Society
            </i>
            . 24.4 (1999). Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/4587126214">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            "Too, and Too Little."
            <i>
             Politics &amp; Gender
            </i>
            . 1.2 (2005): 336-341. Available
            <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/360243655">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <i>
             The Will to Empower: Democratic Citizens and Other Subjects
            </i>
            . Ithaca, NY: Cornell University Press, 1999. Available in the Muhlenberg Room, Trexler Library, call # 324.630973 C955w.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Barbara Cruikshank
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             Alvarez, Cruikshank Receive Mellon LASA Seminars Initiative Award
            </em>
            . University of Massachusetts, 2013. 11 July 2014. Available
            <a href="https://polsci.umass.edu/news_and_events/newslist/view/289/">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
           <p>
            <em>
             Barbara Cruikshank
            </em>
            . University of Massachusetts, 2014. Web. 11 July 2014. Available
            <a href="https://polsci.umass.edu/profiles/cruikshank_barbara">
             here
            </a>
            .
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about activism and protest movements
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           Hall, Simon.
           <i>
            American Patriotism, American Protest: Social Movements Since the Sixties
           </i>
           . Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2011. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/761340909">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </blockquote>
          <blockquote>
           Lin, Nan.
           <i>
            Social Capital: A Theory of Social Structure and Action
           </i>
           . Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 2001. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/51296811">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </blockquote>
          <blockquote>
           McAnany, Emile G.
           <i>
            Saving the World: A Brief History of Communication for Development and Social Change
           </i>
           . Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 2012. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/826443610">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </blockquote>
          <div id="boxatt18744883" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18757472">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18757472">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18757472">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Muhlenberg Alumni Activism (12 September 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18757472">
          <p>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about the panelists
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Alexander Lotorto
           </em>
           . 2011. Available
           <a href="http://alexlotorto.blogspot.com/">
            here
           </a>
           .&nbsp;
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <span>
            <em>
             Alumni Profiles: Kelly Howe
            </em>
            . N.d. Available
            <a href="http://www.muhlenberg.edu/main/academics/theatre-dance/meetourAlumni/howe.html">
             here
            </a>
            .
            <br />
           </span>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <span>
            Baxter, Christopher. "Newsmaker Q&amp;A: Adrian Shanker Gay Rights Advocate."&nbsp;
           </span>
           <i>
            Morning Call,
           </i>
           <span>
            &nbsp;Jan 23, 2011. Available
            <a href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/docview/847080335?accountid=40980">
             here
            </a>
            .
            <br />
           </span>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Brelje, Beth. "Practiced Protesters Lock Arms Against Tennessee Pipeline."&nbsp;
           <em>
            Pocono Record,&nbsp;
           </em>
           Feb 19, 2013. Available
           <a href="http://www.poconorecord.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20130219/NEWS/302190327">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Schiavo, Christine. "Advocate for Gays, Lesbians Newsmaker Q&amp;A: Adrian Shanker."&nbsp;
           <i>
            Morning Call,
           </i>
           &nbsp;Jan 27, 2013. Available
           <a href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/docview/1282198524?accountid=40980">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about activism
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Daisey, Mike. "The Sin Of Activism."
           <i>
            American Theatre
           </i>
           29.4 (2012): 10-11. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=73955152&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Fritsvold, Erik D. "Under The Law: Legal Consciousness And Radical Environmental Activism."
           <i>
            Law &amp; Social Inquiry
           </i>
           34.4 (2009): 799-824.Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=45231717&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Stephenson, Wen. "We Have To Shut It Down."
           <i>
            Nation
           </i>
           297.5/6 (2013): 24-28. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=89152614&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Swank, Eric, and Breanne Fahs. "An Intersectional Analysis of Gender and Race for Sexual Minorities Who Engage in Gay and Lesbian Rights Activism."
           <i>
            Sex Roles
           </i>
           68.11/12 (2013): 660-674. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=87563775&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18757472" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>

       <div id="wrapbox18761574">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18761574">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18761574">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Scott Lemieux (17 September 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18761574">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works by
           </strong>
           <strong>
            Scott Lemieux
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Author Page for Scott Lemieux." Web blog post.&nbsp;
           <em>
            Lawyers, Guns &amp; Money
           </em>
           . 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.lawyersgunsmoneyblog.com/author/scott-lemieux">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Scalia Gets It Right." Web blog post.&nbsp;
           <em>
            The American Prospect
           </em>
           . 3 June 2013. Available
           <a href="http://prospect.org/article/scalia-gets-it-right">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;The Zimmerman Acquittal Isn&rsquo;t about &lsquo;Stand Your Ground.&rsquo;&rdquo; Web blog post.&nbsp;
           <em>
            The American Prospect
           </em>
           . 14 July 2013. Available
           <a href="http://prospect.org/article/zimmerman-acquittal-isnt-about-stand-your-ground">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about
           </strong>
           <strong>
            Scott Lemieux
           </strong>
           <br />
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <em>
            Lemieux, Scott
           </em>
           . 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.strose.edu/academics/schoolofartsandhumanities/historypoliticalscience/faculty/drscottlemieux">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about blogging as activism
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Amin, Ramtin. "The Empire Strikes Back: Social Media Uprisings And The Future Of Cyber Activism."
           <i>
            Kennedy School Review
           </i>
           10.(2010): 64-66. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=59832558&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Keren, Michael. "Blogging And Mass Politics."
           <i>
            Biography: An Interdisciplinary Quarterly
           </i>
           33.1 (2010): 110-126. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=51499562&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Ma'anit, Adam. "A World Wide Web Of Change."
           <i>
            New Internationalist
           </i>
           435 (2010): 21-24. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=52920255&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Ortiz, David G., and Stephen F. Ostertag. "Katrina Bloggers And The Development Of Collective Civic Action: The Web As A Virtual Mobilizing Structure."
           <i>
            Sociological Perspectives
           </i>
           57.1 (2014): 52-78. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=94873668&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
          </p>
          <p>

       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18766119">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18766119">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18766119">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           The Molly Maguires (23 September 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18766119">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about
           </strong>
           <strong>
            the film
            <em>
             The Molly Maguires
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <font class="TF">
            <font class="tf">
             Guy, F. "James Bond, what are You Doing in that Coal Mine?"
             <em>
              New York Times
             </em>
             : 1. Jun 16 1968.Available
             <a href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/docview/118303816?accountid=40980">
              here
             </a>
             .
            </font>
           </font>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <strong>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <em>
           </em>
           Rapold, Nicolas. "The Molly Maguires."
           <i>
            Film Comment
           </i>
           49.5 (2013): 76. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=f3h&amp;AN=90062700&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <font class="TF">
            <font class="tf">
             Roger, G. "Screen: 'Molly Maguires'."
             <i>
              New York Times
             </i>
             : 46. Feb 09 1970. Available
             <a href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/docview/119081576?accountid=40980">
              here
             </a>
             .
             <br />
            </font>
           </font>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <font class="TF">
            <font class="tf">
             <font class="TF">
              <font class="tf">
               Thomas, O. "Martin Ritt: Human Relationships and Moral Choices Fuel His Movies."
               <i>
                New York Times
               </i>
               : 2. Jan 12 1986. Available
               <a href="https://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.proquest.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/docview/110931205?accountid=40980">
                here
               </a>
               .
               <br />
              </font>
             </font>
            </font>
           </font>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Background about the Molly Maguires
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Bimba, Anthony.
           <i>
            The Molly Maguires
           </i>
           . New York: International Publishers, 1950. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call # 364.14 B611m.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Bloom, Joseph H. "Undermining The Molly Maguires."
           <i>
            American History
           </i>
           34.3 (1999): 54. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=31h&amp;AN=2112056&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Kenny, Kevin.
           <i>
            Making Sense of the Molly Maguires
           </i>
           . New York: Oxford University Press, 1998. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call # 364.14 K36m and as an
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/36138393">
            e-book
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">

         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18767762">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Erik Loomis (24 September 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18767762">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Work
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            s by Erik Loomis
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Author Page for Erik Loomis." Web blog post.&nbsp;
           <em>
            Lawyers, Guns &amp; Money
           </em>
           . 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.lawyersgunsmoneyblog.com/author/erik.loomis/">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           ["
           <em>
            Labor Online
           </em>
           &nbsp;Blog Posts by Erik Loomis."]&nbsp;
           <em>
            Labor and Working Class History Association.
           </em>
           2014. Available
           <a href="http://lawcha.org/wordpress/author/eloomis/">
            here.
           </a>
           <strong>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Loomis, E, and R Edgington. "Lives Under the Canopy: Spotted Owls and Loggers in Western Forests."
           <i>
            Natural Resources Journal
           </i>
           . 52.1 (2013): 99-134. Available
           <a href="http://www.lexisnexis.com.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/lnacui2api/api/version1/getDocCui?lni=56RG-6PS0-01TH-N02J&amp;csi=271800&amp;hl=t&amp;hv=t&amp;hnsd=f&amp;hns=t&amp;hgn=t&amp;oc=00240&amp;perma=true">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Erik Loomis
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Dr. Erik Loomis
           </em>
           . University of Rhode Island, 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.uri.edu/artsci/his/Erik_Loomis.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "University of Rhode Island Issues New Statement on Erik Loomis."
           <em>
            Crooked Timber
           </em>
           . 24 December 2012. Available
           <a href="http://crookedtimber.org/2012/12/24/university-of-rhode-island-issues-new-statement-on-erik-loomis/">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about labor and environmentalism
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <strong>
           </strong>
           Barca, Stefania. "Laboring The Earth: Transnational Reflections On The Environmental History Of Work."
           <i>
            Environmental History
           </i>
           19.1 (2014): 3-27. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=31h&amp;AN=93064597&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Dreyfus, Philip. "Nature, Militancy, And The Western Worker: Socialist Shingles, Syndicalist Spruce."
           <i>
            Labor: Studies In Working Class History Of The Americas
           </i>
           1.3 (2004): 71-96. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=31h&amp;AN=16709936&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Kiester, Edwin. "A Town Buries The Axe."
           <i>
            Smithsonian
           </i>
           30.4 (1999): 70. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=31h&amp;AN=1974158&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">

           <i>

          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Ursula Rucker (11 October 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18768794">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Work
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            s by Ursula Rucker
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "l.o.v.e."&nbsp;
           <em>
            YouTube
           </em>
           . 2010. Available&nbsp;
           <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rsl_SSuIGcI">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "For Women."&nbsp;&nbsp;
           <em>
            YouTube
           </em>
           . N.d. Available&nbsp;
           <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNq4JRs10OM">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "I Ain't (Yo Punk Ass Bitch)."&nbsp;
           <em>
            YouTube
           </em>
           . 2010. Available
           <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n5CPjBU3OTQ">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Lonely Can Be Sweet."&nbsp;
           <em>
            YouTube
           </em>
           . 2010. Available
           <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sZR2UlDT8SU">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Ursula Rucker
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
           </em>
           Bost, Suzanne. &ldquo;&lsquo;Be Deceived If Ya Wanna Be Foolish&rsquo;: (Re)constructing Body, Genre, and Gender in Feminist Rap.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Postmodern Culture
           </em>
           12.1 (2001): n. pag. Available
           <a href="https://muse.jhu.edu.muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/journals/postmodern_culture/v012/12.1bost.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
           <em>
           </em>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Nopper, Sheila. "Ma'at Mama."
           <i>
            Herizons
           </i>
           20.4 (2007): 40-41. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=24102488&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Roseberry, Craig. "'Supa Sista' Ursula Rucker Makes Poetic Debut On K7."
           <i>
            Billboard
           </i>
           113.36 (2001): 42. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=5100367&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about spoken word poetry
           </strong>
          </p>

           </i>
           36.2 (2012): 161-168. Available

           </a>

          </p>

           <i>

            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">

            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>

         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18779697">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           David Pellow (20 October 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18779697">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Work
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            s by Daniel Pellow
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Brulle, Robert J, and David N. Pellow. "Environmental Justice: Human Health and Environmental Inequalities."
           <em>
            Annual Review of Public Health
           </em>
           . 27.1 (2006). Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/4562528214">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "From "Just Us" to Justice: Connecting the Environment, Community, and Academy."
           <i>
            Sociological Forum
           </i>
           . 14.2 (1999). Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/4556183190">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <i>
            Garbage Wars: The Struggle for Environmental Justice in Chicago
           </i>
           . Cambridge, Mass: MIT, 2004. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call # 363.728 P392g.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Park, Lisa S.-H, and David N. Pellow.
           <i>
            The Slums of Aspen: Immigrants Vs. the Environment in America's Eden
           </i>
           . New York: New York University Press, 2011. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/751983195">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Pellow, David N, and Lisa S.-H. Park.
           <i>
            The Silicon Valley of Dreams: Environmental Injustice, Immigrant Workers, and the High-Tech Global Economy
           </i>
           . New York: New York University Press, 2002. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/50479220">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Smith, Ted, David A. Sonnenfeld, and David N. Pellow.
           <i>
            Challenging the Chip: Labor Rights and Environmental Justice in the Global Electronics Industry
           </i>
           . Philadelphia: Temple University Press, 2006. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/166422517">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Weinberg, Adam S, David N. Pellow, and Allan Schnaiberg.
           <i>
            Urban Recycling and the Search for Sustainable Community Development
           </i>
           . Princeton, N.J: Princeton University Press, 2000. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/43227418">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Daniel Pellow
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Daniel Pellow
           </em>
           . 2014. Available
           <a href="https://www.soc.umn.edu/people/pellow_d.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Desai, Uday. "Resisting Global Toxics Transnational Movements For Environmental Justice &ndash; By David Naguib Pellow."
           <i>
            Review Of Policy Research
           </i>
           25.6 (2008): 584-586. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=36108382&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Potter, Will. &ldquo;FBI Harasses Sociology Professor Who Has Spoken Out Against the Green Scare.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Green Is The New Red
           </em>
           . 18 May 2010. Available
           <a href="http://www.greenisthenewred.com/blog/david-pellow-visited-by-fbi/2848/">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Replogle, Jill. "Aspen Logic."
           <i>
            NACLA Report On The Americas
           </i>
           45.4 (2012): 76-78. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=85244398&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about environmental justice
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Hall, Matthew.
           <i>
            Victims of Environmental Harm: Rights, Recognition and Redress Under National and International Law
           </i>
           . Florence, KY: Taylor and Francis, 2013. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/841852588">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Wilks, Sarah.
           <i>
            Seeking Environmental Justice
           </i>
           . Amsterdam: Rodopi, 2008. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/228506750">
            here
           </a>

          </p>

       <div id="wrapbox18781374">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18781374">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18781374">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Caroll Bogert (27-30 October)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18781374">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Work
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            s by Caroll Bogert
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;What Are the BRICS Building?&rdquo;
           <em>
            Slate
           </em>
           . The Slate Group, 28 Mar. 2013. Available
           <a href="http://www.slate.com/articles/news_and_politics/foreigners/2013/03/brics_summit_in_durban_south_africa_is_this_odd_economic_coalition_becoming.html">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Old Hands, New Voice.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Columbia Journalism Review
           </em>
           . 24 March 2009. Available
           <a href="http://www.cjr.org/feature/old_hands_new_voice.php">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;Similar Paths, Different Missions: International Journalists and Human Rights Observers.&rdquo;
           <em>
            Nieman Reports
           </em>
           . 1 October 2010. Available
           <a href="http://www.nieman.harvard.edu/reportsitem.aspx?id=102468">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           &ldquo;There&rsquo;s Something You Need to See at Guantanamo Bay.&rdquo;
           <em>
            POLITICO Magazine
           </em>
           . 22 January 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2014/01/guantanamo-bay-something-you-need-to-see-102481.html#.U8gKolPSQ24">
            here
           </a>
           .
           <span class="Z3988" title="url_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fzotero.org%3A2&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Adc&amp;rft.type=webpage&amp;rft.title=Nieman%20Reports%20%7C%20Similar%20Paths%2C%20Different%20Missions%3A%20International%20Journalists%20and%20Human%20Rights%20Observers&amp;rft.description=As%20some%20journalists%20migrate%20to%20Human%20Rights%20Watch%2C%20one%20reason%20might%20be%20that%20they%20are%20%E2%80%98tired%20of%20treating%20all%20stories%20with%20the%20same%20pretense%20of%20aloofness%E2%80%94especially%20the%20ones%20who%20have%20covered%20mass%20atrocities.%E2%80%99&amp;rft.identifier=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nieman.harvard.edu%2Freportsitem.aspx%3Fid%3D102468">
           </span>
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Caroll Bogert
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Caroll Bogert."
           <em>
            Human Rights Watch
           </em>
           . Human Rights Watch, 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.hrw.org/bios/carroll-bogert">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about media coverage of human rights
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           AbuZayyad, Ziad Khalil. "Human Rights, The Internet And Social Media: Has Technology Changed The Way See Things?."
           <i>
            Palestine-Israel Journal Of Politics, Economics &amp; Culture
           </i>
           18.4 (2013): 38-40. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=89586588&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Apodaca, Clair. "The Whole World Could Be Watching: Human Rights And The Media."
           <i>
            Journal Of Human Rights
           </i>
           6.2 (2007): 147-164. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=25729274&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Gulati, Girish. "News Frames And Story Triggers In The Media's Coverage Of Human Trafficking."
           <i>
            Human Rights Review
           </i>
           12.3 (2011): 363-379. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=64307773&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Shaw, Ibrahim S.
           <i>
            Human Rights Journalism: Advances in Reporting Distant Humanitarian Interventions
           </i>
           . Houndmills, Basingstoke, Hampshire: Palgrave Macmillan, 2012. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call # 070.449323 S534h.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18781374" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox18785596">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="18785596">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title18785596">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Nancy Fraser (13 November 2014)
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content18785596">
          <p>
           <strong>
            Work
            <em>
            </em>
           </strong>
           <strong>
            s by Nancy Fraser
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Abnormal Justice."
           <i>
            Critical Inquiry
           </i>
           34.3 (2008): 393-422. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=32724960&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Fraser, Nancy, and Axel Honneth.
           <em>
            <i>
             Redistribution or Recognition?: A Political-Philosophical Exchange
            </i>
            .
           </em>
           London: Verso, 2003. Available in the Muhlenberg Room, Trexler Library at call #&nbsp;303.372 F842r.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Injustice At Intersecting Scales: On 'Social Exclusion' And The 'Global Poor.'"
           <i>
            European Journal Of Social Theory
           </i>
           13.3 (2010): 363-371. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=52687096&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <em>
            Justice Interruptus: Critical Reflections on the "Postsocialist" Condition.
           </em>
           New York: Routledge, 1997. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call #&nbsp;320.011 F842j.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Recognition Without Ethics?."
           <i>
            Theory, Culture &amp; Society
           </i>
           18.2/3 (2001): 21. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=6555346&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <i>
            Scales of Justice: Reimagining Political Space in a Globalizing World
           </i>
           . New York: Columbia University Press, 2009. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/698589717">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           <i>
            Unruly Practices: Power, Discourse, and Gender in Contemporary Social Theory
           </i>
           . Minneapolis: University of Minnesota Press, 1989. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.on.worldcat.org/discoveryoclc/19555907">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about Nancy Fraser and her scholarship
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Funk, Nanette. "Contra Fraser On Feminism And Neoliberalism."
           <i>
            Hypatia
           </i>
           28.1 (2013): 179-196. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=85318943&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Gransow, Bettina. "Reclaiming The Neighbourhood."
           <i>
            China Perspectives
           </i>
           2014.2 (2014): 17-25. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=96166043&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           "Nancy Fraser."
           <em>
            New School for Social Research.
           </em>
           New School, 2014. Available
           <a href="http://www.newschool.edu/nssr/faculty.aspx?id=10288">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Works about justice from feminist perspectives
            <br />
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Enns, Carolyn Z, and Ada L. Sinacore.
           <i>
            Teaching and Social Justice: Integrating Multicultural and Feminist Theories in the Classroom
           </i>
           . Washington, DC: American Psychological Association, 2005. Available in Trexler Library, Muhlenberg Room, call # 370.115 E59t.
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Fabos, Anita, and Emily Haddad. "Toward A Feminist Analysis Of 'Impact': Sondra Hale's Scholarship And Activism In And Beyond The University."
           <i>
            Journal Of Middle East Women's Studies
           </i>
           10.1 (2013): 53-81. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=93274280&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p style="padding-left: 30px;">
           Matthews, Sally. "Reflections On The Appropriate Use Of Unjustly Conferred Privilege."
           <i>
            Theoria: A Journal Of Social &amp; Political Theory
           </i>
           60.135 (2013): 23-41. Available
           <a href="http://muhlenberg.idm.oclc.org/login?url=http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&amp;db=aph&amp;AN=89395940&amp;login.asp&amp;site=ehost-live&amp;scope=site">
            here
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt18785596" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>

             <div class="profile_display_name">

             </div>
